Identification.LongTitle: First Nations Oil and Gas and Moneys Management Voting Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Indian Affairs and Northern Development, pursuant to paragraph 62(a) of the First Nations Oil and Gas and Moneys Management Acta, hereby makes the annexed First Nations Oil and Gas and Moneys Management Voting Regulations.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the First Nations Oil and Gas and Moneys Management Act. (Loi)
Assistant Deputy Minister means the Assistant Deputy Minister, Lands and Trusts Services, Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development. (sous-ministre adjoint)
deputy electoral officer means a person so designated by the electoral officer under subsection 3(2) for the purpose of a vote. (président du scrutin)
electoral officer means the person so designated by the council of a first nation under paragraph 3(1)(a) for the purpose of a vote. (président d’élection)
first nation membership number means the number assigned to a first nation member on the Band List of the first nation. (numéro de membre de la première nation)
legal adviser means any person qualified, in accordance with the laws of a province, to give legal advice. (conseiller juridique)
mail-in ballot means a ballot delivered or mailed in accordance with section 7. (bulletin de vote postal)
registry number means the number assigned to a person registered under section 5 of the Indian Act. (numéro de registre)
reserve, in respect of a vote, means a reserve of the first nation that is conducting the vote. (réserve)
voter declaration form means a form that, when completed, sets out the information required by section 8. (formulaire de déclaration de l’électeur)

Section.MarginalNote: Vote under s. 17 or 18 of the Act
Section.Text: These Regulations apply to a vote held under section 17 or 18 of the Act.

Subsection.Text: The council of a first nation that intends to conduct a vote must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: designate a person to be the electoral officer for the purpose of the vote; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: forward a written resolution to the Minister notifying the Minister of its intention to hold the vote and identifying the electoral officer.

Subsection.Text: The electoral officer must designate one or more persons to be deputy electoral officers for the purpose of the vote.
The electoral officer and the deputy electoral officers must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: supervise the conduct of the vote in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act with fairness and impartiality in the administration of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: perform the duties and functions that are necessary for the administration of these Regulations.

Section.Text: The question to be put to the eligible voters is set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in Part 1 of the schedule, in the case of the ratification of an oil and gas code and a financial code referred to in section 10 of the Act and the approval of the transfer to a first nation of the management and regulation of oil and gas exploration and exploitation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in Part 2 of the schedule, in the case of the ratification of a financial code referred to in section 11 of the Act and the approval of the payment of moneys to a first nation in accordance with the code; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in Part 3 of the schedule, in the case of a single vote on the ratification of an oil and gas code and a financial code referred to in section 10 of the Act, the approval of the transfer to a first nation of the management and regulation of oil and gas exploration and exploitation, the ratification of a financial code referred to in section 11 of the Act and the approval of the payment of moneys to the first nation in accordance with the code.

Subsection.Text: At least 49 days before the day on which a vote is to be held, a list of all eligible voters must be provided to the electoral officer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by the first nation, if the first nation has assumed control of its own membership under section 10 of the Indian Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by the Registrar, if the Band List of the first nation is maintained in the Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development under section 11 of the Indian Act.

Subsection.Text: A voters list must set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the names of all eligible voters, in alphabetical order; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the first nation membership number or registry number of each eligible voter or, if the eligible voter does not have a first nation membership number or registry number, the date of birth of the eligible voter.

Subsection.Text: On request, the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must confirm whether the name of a person is on the voters list.
The electoral officer must revise the voters list if it is demonstrated that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of an eligible voter has been omitted from the list;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of an eligible voter is incorrectly set out on the list; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of a person not qualified to vote is included on the list.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (4), a person may demonstrate that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of an eligible voter has been omitted from, or incorrectly set out on, the voters list by presenting to the electoral officer evidence from the Registrar or from the first nation that the eligible voter is on the Band List and has reached the eligible age for participation in the vote; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of a person not qualified to vote has been included on the voters list by presenting to the electoral officer evidence that the person is not on the Band List or has not reached the eligible age for participation in the vote.

Section.Text: At least 49 days before the day on which a vote is to be held, the latest known addresses, if any, of the eligible voters who do not reside on the reserve must be provided to the electoral officer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by the first nation, if the first nation has assumed control of its own membership under section 10 of the Indian Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by the Registrar, if the Band List of the first nation is maintained in the Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development under section 11 of the Indian Act.

Subsection.Text: On the earlier of 14 days before the day on which the information meeting for a vote is to be held and 42 days before the day of the vote, the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: post a notice of the vote and a list of the eligible voters in at least one conspicuous place on the reserve;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: mail or deliver to every eligible voter of the first nation who does not reside on the reserve and for whom an address has been provided

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a mail-in ballot, initialled on the back by the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an outer, postage-paid return envelope, pre-addressed to the electoral officer,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a second, inner envelope marked “Ballot” for insertion of the completed ballot,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a letter of instruction regarding voting by mail-in ballot, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: an information package regarding the vote.

Subsection.Text: A notice of a vote must state

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the question to be submitted to the eligible voters;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the vote will be held;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the location of each polling station and the hours that it will be open for voting;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that eligible voters may vote either in person at a polling station in accordance with subsection 17(3) or by mail-in ballot;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name and telephone number of the electoral officer; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the date, time and location of the information meeting.

Subsection.Text: If an eligible voter makes a request to the electoral officer, at least seven days before the vote, for the material referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the electoral officer must provide the material to the eligible voter.

The electoral officer must indicate on the voters list that a ballot has been provided to each eligible voter to whom a mail-in ballot was mailed, delivered or otherwise provided, and keep a record of the date on which, and the address, if any, to which, each mail-in ballot was mailed or delivered.

An eligible voter to whom a mail-in ballot was mailed, delivered or provided under subsection (1) or (3) is not entitled to vote in person at a polling station other than in accordance with subsection 17(3).

Section.Text: An eligible voter’s completed voter declaration form must set out

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the eligible voter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the first nation membership number or registry number of the eligible voter or, if the eligible voter does not have a first nation membership number or registry number, the date of birth of the eligible voter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the eligible voter has read the information in the information package regarding the question that is the subject of the vote, or that the information was read to the eligible voter, and that the eligible voter understood the information;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the eligible voter has voted freely and without compulsion; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of a witness to the signature of the eligible voter.

Subsection.Text: Before the day on which a vote is to be held, the council of the first nation must ensure that an information meeting is held to provide the eligible voters with information regarding the vote.

A legal adviser and a financial adviser, designated by the council of the first nation, must be present at the information meeting and an interpreter must also be present to interpret between those advisers and the eligible voters.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Information to be provided by the advisers
Subsection.Text: The legal adviser and the financial adviser who are present at the information meeting must advise the eligible voters about the following subjects, according to their respective expertise:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the processes for the implementation of the Act, including the voting process;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vote on the ratification of an oil and gas code and a financial code referred to in section 10 of the Act and the approval of the transfer to the first nation of the management and regulation of oil and gas exploration and exploitation, the possible legal and financial consequences of the ratification of the oil and gas code, the financial code and the transfer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a vote on the ratification of a financial code referred to in section 11 of the Act and the approval of the payment of moneys to the first nation in accordance with the code, the possible legal and financial consequences of the ratification of the financial code and the payment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the content of the question that is the subject of the vote and the possible legal and financial consequences of an affirmative vote or a negative vote.

Subsection.Text: The legal adviser and the financial adviser who are present at the information meeting must, according to their respective expertise, answer the questions of the eligible voters concerning the vote, including any questions about the subjects referred to in subsection (3).

Section.Text: The council of the first nation must send to the Minister after the information meeting is held, but before the vote, the following information and documents about the information meeting:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the time when the meeting was held and the place where it was held;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the names and addresses of the legal adviser and the financial adviser who were present; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: written confirmation, signed by the legal adviser and the financial adviser, that they advised the eligible voters about the subjects referred to in subsection 9(3).

Section.Text: The electoral officer or the deputy electoral officers must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepare sufficient ballots stating the question to be submitted to the eligible voters and ensure that the initials of the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer are placed on the back of each ballot;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: procure a sufficient number of ballot boxes; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: before the polls are opened, cause the ballots and a sufficient number of lead pencils for marking the ballots to be delivered to the polls.

Subsection.Text: An eligible voter may vote by mail-in ballot by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: marking the ballot by placing a cross, check mark or other mark, clearly indicating the eligible voter’s response to the question that is the subject of the vote;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: folding the ballot in a manner that conceals the question and any marks but exposes the initials on the back;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: placing the ballot in the inner envelope and sealing that envelope;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: completing the voter declaration form and signing the completed form in the presence of a witness who is at least 18 years of age;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: placing the inner envelope and the completed, signed and witnessed voter declaration form in the outer envelope; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: delivering or, subject to subsection (6), mailing the outer envelope to the electoral officer before the time at which the polls close on the day of the vote.

Subsection.Text: An eligible voter who is unable to vote in the manner set out in subsection (1) may enlist the assistance of another person to mark the ballot and complete and sign the voter declaration form in accordance with subsection (1).
A witness referred to in paragraph (1)(d) must attest to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the person signing the voter declaration form is the person whose name is set out on the form; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the eligible voter enlisted the assistance of another person under subsection (2), the fact that the eligible voter is the person whose name is set out on the form and that the ballot was marked according to the directions of the eligible voter.

Subsection.Text: An eligible voter who inadvertently spoils a mail-in ballot may obtain another ballot by returning the spoiled ballot to the electoral officer.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Replacing ballot lost or not received
Subsection.Text: An eligible voter who loses or has not received a mail-in ballot may obtain another ballot by delivering to the electoral officer a written affirmation that the eligible voter has lost or has not received the mail-in ballot, signed by the eligible voter in the presence of the electoral officer, a justice of the peace, a notary public or a commissioner for oaths.
Mail-in ballots that are not received by the electoral officer before the time at which the polls close on the day of the vote are void and must not be counted as votes cast.

Section.Text: The electoral officer must establish at least one polling station on the reserve.
The electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must provide a compartment at each polling place where the eligible voter can mark his or her ballot free from observation.

The electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must, immediately before the opening of the poll, open the ballot box and call on those persons who are present to witness that it is empty and must then lock the ballot box and seal it — so as to ensure that any opening of the ballot box will be made obvious by a disturbance to the seal — using one of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a mechanical device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: adhesive tape or seal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other method that achieves the same result.

Subsection.Text: Polling stations must be kept open from 9:00 a.m., local time, until 8:00 p.m., local time, on the day of the vote.
An eligible voter who is inside a polling station at the time that the polling station is to close is entitled to vote.

Subject to subsection 7(5), if a person whose name is set out on the voters list attends at a polling station for the purpose of voting, the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must provide the person with a ballot.
The electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must place on the voters list a mark opposite the name of every eligible voter receiving a ballot.
An eligible voter to whom a mail-in ballot was mailed, delivered or provided under subsection 7(1) or (3) may obtain a ballot and vote in person at a polling station if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the eligible voter returns the mail-in ballot to the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the eligible voter has lost or has not received the mail-in ballot, the eligible voter provides the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer with a written affirmation that the eligible voter has lost or has not received the mail-in ballot, signed by the eligible voter in the presence of the electoral officer, a deputy electoral officer, a justice of the peace, a notary public or a commissioner for oaths.

Subsection.Text: The electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must explain the mode of voting to an eligible voter when requested to do so by the eligible voter.

At the request of an eligible voter who is not able to read or who is incapacitated by blindness or other physical cause, the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must assist the eligible voter by marking the eligible voter’s ballot in the manner directed by the eligible voter and must place the ballot in the ballot box.

The electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must make an entry on the voters list opposite the name of the eligible voter indicating that the ballot was marked by him or her at the request of the eligible voter and the reasons for the request.

Section.Text: Except as provided in subsection 18(2), every eligible voter receiving a ballot must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: proceed immediately to the compartment provided for marking the ballot;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: mark the ballot by placing a cross, check mark or other mark, clearly indicating the eligible voter’s response to the question that is the subject of the vote;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fold the ballot in a manner that conceals the question and any marks but exposes the initials on the back; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: deliver it without delay to the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer for deposit in the ballot box.

Subsection.Text: An eligible voter who receives a soiled or improperly printed ballot, or who inadvertently spoils his or her ballot in marking it, and who returns the ballot to the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer is entitled to another ballot.
An eligible voter who receives a ballot forfeits his or her right to vote if he or she

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: leaves the compartment for marking ballots without delivering the ballot to the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer in the manner provided; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: refuses to vote.

Subsection.Text: In a case described in subsection (2), the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must make an entry on the voters list opposite the name of the eligible voter indicating that the eligible voter did not return the ballot or refused to vote, as the case may be.

Section.Text: The electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer must allow only one eligible voter in the compartment for marking ballots at any one time.

Subsection.Text: No person may interfere or attempt to interfere with an eligible voter when the eligible voter is marking his or her ballot.
No person may obtain or attempt to obtain at the polling place information as to how an eligible voter is about to vote or has voted.

Section.Text: If the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer does not understand the language spoken by an eligible voter, the electoral officer or the deputy electoral officer must enlist the aid of an interpreter to communicate with respect to all matters required to enable that eligible voter to vote.

After the close of the polls, the electoral officer must, in the presence of a deputy electoral officer and any members of the council of the first nation who are present, open each envelope containing a mail-in ballot that was received before the close of the polls and, without unfolding the ballot,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: set aside the ballot if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is not accompanied by a voter declaration form or the voter declaration form is not signed or witnessed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the eligible voter set out in the voter declaration form is not on the voters list, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the voters list shows that the eligible voter has already voted; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: place a mark on the voters list opposite the name of the eligible voter set out on the voter declaration form and deposit the ballot in a ballot box.

Subsection.Text: After the mail-in ballots have been deposited under section 24, the electoral officer must, in the presence of a deputy electoral officer and any members of the council of the first nation who are present, open all ballot boxes and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: examine the ballots;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: set aside any ballot that does not have the initials of the electoral officer or a deputy electoral officer on the back;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: reject all ballots

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: that have been marked incorrectly, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: on which anything appears by which an eligible voter can be identified;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: count the votes cast in favour of and against the question submitted in the vote; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: prepare a statement in writing of the number of votes so cast and of the number of ballots rejected.

Subsection.Text: The statement referred to in paragraph (1)(e) must be

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: signed by the electoral officer and by the chief or a member of the council of the first nation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: filed in the regional office of the Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development.

Section.Text: A ballot set aside under paragraph 24(a) or 25(1)(b) or rejected under paragraph 25(1)(c) is void and must not be counted as a vote cast.
When the results of the voting are known, the electoral officer must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepare a statement in triplicate, signed by the electoral officer and by the chief or a member of the council of the first nation, that confirms that the vote was conducted in accordance with these Regulations and indicates the number of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: eligible voters who were entitled to vote,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: votes cast in favour of and against the question submitted in the vote, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: deliver a copy of the statement to

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person in charge of the regional office of the Department of Indian Affairs and Northern Development, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the chief of the first nation.

Subsection.Text: The electoral officer must deposit the ballots used in the voting, together with all supporting documents, in a sealed envelope and retain them.
If no review has been requested within 60 days after the day of the vote, the electoral officer must destroy the ballots used in the voting.
An eligible voter may, in the manner set out in subsection (2), request a review of the vote by the Minister if the eligible voter believes that there was

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a contravention of these Regulations that may affect the results of the vote; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a corrupt practice in connection with the vote.

Subsection.Text: A request for a review of a vote must be forwarded to the Minister, by registered mail addressed to the Assistant Deputy Minister, within 30 days after the day of the vote. The request must be accompanied by a declaration containing the grounds for requesting the review and any other relevant information and must be signed in the presence of a witness who is at least 18 years of age.

Section.MarginalNote: Minister to advise Governor in Council
Section.Text: If the material referred to in subsection 29(2) or any other information in the possession of the Minister is sufficient to call into question the validity of a vote on the ratification of an oil and gas code and a financial code referred to in section 10 of the Act and the approval of the transfer to the first nation of the management and regulation of oil and gas exploration and exploitation, the Minister must advise the Governor in Council accordingly.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Text.Emphasis: This is the question to be put to the eligible voters:

Provision.Text: Do you approve of the oil and gas code and financial code developed by [insert the name of the first nation] and the transfer to [insert the name of the first nation] of the management and regulation of oil and gas exploration and exploitation in the reserve lands of [insert the name of the first nation]?

Text.Emphasis: This is the question to be put to the eligible voters:

Provision.Text: Do you approve of the financial code of [insert the name of the first nation], dated [insert the date of the financial code], and the payment to the [insert the name of the first nation], in accordance with the financial code, of all moneys held today, and all moneys to be collected or received in future, by Her Majesty for the use and benefit of the [insert the name of the first nation]?

Text.Emphasis: This is the question to be put to the eligible voters:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: the oil and gas code and the financial code dated [insert the date of the financial code], developed by [insert the name of the first nation], and the transfer to [insert the name of the first nation] of the management and regulation of oil and gas exploration and exploitation in the reserve lands of [insert the name of the first nation], and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: the financial code dated [insert the date of the financial code] developed by [insert the name of the first nation] and the payment to the [insert the name of the first nation], in accordance with that financial code, of all moneys held today, and all moneys to be collected or received in future, by Her Majesty for the use and benefit of the [insert the name of the first nation]?
